description: LNK files typically use the same icon as their target file, with a small curled arrow added to indicate the shortcut points to another location. When you double-click an LNK file, Windows opens the file to which that shortcut points, just as it would if you double-clicked the actual file.

You can edit a Windows shortcut's properties, to add a shortcut key or modify how Windows opens the file to which the shortcut points. To edit a shortcut's properties, right-click the shortcut and select Properties .

Even if you've configured Windows to show file extensions for known file types, it does not show the .lnk file extension. While not recommended, you can make Windows show the .lnk file extension by deleting the NeverShowExt property within the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\â€‹lnkfile Windows registry entry:
Read more about Windows shortcuts in the FileInfo.com Help Center .
NOTE: Changes to the LNK file association can cause your Windows desktop icons to unexpectedly change or disappear. You can visit the Help Center for instructions on how to fix your Windows icons .
